definitions.definition: A specification of an object or process, referring to requirements to be satisfied and thus conditions to be met for them to solve a problem.
A plan (with more or less detail) for the structure and functions of an artifact, building or system.
A pattern, as an element of a work of art or architecture.
The composition of a work of art.

definitions.example: To be hateful of the truth by design.

definitions.definition: The shape or appearance given to an object, especially one that is intended to make it more attractive.
To plan and carry out (a picture, work of art, construction etc.).

definitions.example: The king designed to mount an expedition to the New World.

definitions.definition: To assign, appoint (something to someone); to designate.
To mark out and exhibit; to designate; to indicate; to show; to point out; to appoint.
To manifest requirements to be satisfied by an object or process for them to solve a problem.
definitions.example: The client had me create new designs until they were satisfied with one.
